feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Accelerator Hub
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Accelerator Hub Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Is there any API in sap public cloud to read the full Journal Entry XML data?
entry.content:
Hi,

I need to read existing JE XML data that were created manually by users, in order to customize an external system to send customized JE to SAP Public Cloud version.

However in SAP Business Accelerator Hub portal, I only find APIs that allow me to read JE item data and not the full JE document. These are some API that I tested and only allow me to read JE item data:

API_OPLACCTGDOCITEMCUBE_SRV
API_OPLACCTGDOCITEMCUBE_SRV
API_GLACCOUNTLINEITEM

Isn't there any API to read a specific JE XML full structure?

I was wondering if I could use other APIs to update existing JE like JOURNALENTRYBULKCHANGEREQUEST and then I could get the full JE XML in the response...

Please help!

Thanks

entry.title: How to know if the element is an OData entity
entry.content:
Dear community,

Is there any way to confirm if the field is accessible with the OData APIs and, if it is, which OData API service to use to access it?

For example, how do you know whether this field "Goods Issue Date" is available for some OData API service?

Also, how do you find an accessible API to the field?

I would appereciate any small information on this!

Thanks&Regards,

entry.title: Journal Entry API XML example with item with 0% VAT tax
entry.content:
Hi,

I need to send a JE XML document via SAP S/4 Public Cloud API, containing an item with 0% VAT tax value.

Currently I can send JE XML documents with success via API JOURNALENTRYCREATEREQUESTCONFI with the following main XML structure:

<soapenv:Envelope ...>
  <soapenv:Body>
    <sfin:JournalEntryBulkCreateRequest>
      <JournalEntryCreateRequest>
        <JournalEntry>
          <Item>...</Item>
          <Item>...</Item>
          ...
        <JournalEntry>

Now I need to send JE entries with 0% VAT values on specific CoA accounts that have mandatory VAT data.

After analysis I found that I need to add a <Tax> tag inside the <Item> tag, and in the end of <Item> tag list, some <DebtorItem> or <ProductTaxItem> tags, like I found in this example:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blogs-by-sap/payload-examples-for-api-journal-entry-post/ba-p/13392342 
 
However I always get errors when sending JE via POSTMAN (Tax statement item missing for tax code XXX, etc) and can't find any practical example with 0% VAT tax value.
 
Does anybody know what is the correct XML structure to send a JE document with 0% VAT value via API?
Thanks

entry.title: How to use events in SAP business accelerator hub in SAP Build?
entry.content:
Hi guys,

We are trying to automate a process whenever an employee is hired through success factors. The general overview is that:

1. New employee is onboarded in SF and the EmployeeHire event in SF will be triggered

2. A process in SAP Build Process Automation is called when the event above is triggered, and should automatically start the process flow

Upon browsing, we saw in SAP Business Accelerator Hub these SF events and tried to use it as the event trigger in SBPA, however, we do not know how the 2 will connect. 

The steps we've currently taken are

1. Under SAP Build > Connectors > Events > Create > choose SAP Business Accelerator Hub as event source > Filter products to only show SAP SuccessFactors > choose an event package (for trying out purposes, we've chosen Employee Central Position Notification Events)

2. Create new SAP Build Process Automation > Create Process > choose Wait for an event as trigger > choose Employee Central Position Data processed

After above steps, we are now in the dark on what are the next steps. One of our main questions is that how will SBPA know which SF system to listen to? Where should this be set/configured? Once these connections are done, are there other steps that we need to do? Any help on how we can achieve the general overview is very much appreciated.

Thanks,

erza

Regards,
Ankit Gupta

entry.title: Issues with SAP Business Hub REST API consumption in CAP App
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a scenario, where I need to fetch all data from OMF Product API which is available in SAP Business Acclerator Hub as a REST service.

Overview | Products | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

When I import the JSON/YAML service as directed in all CAP guides, it is imported. But there is no entity definition.

My objective is to fetch all the records with $top and $skip and show it in a simple CAP List View app without storing it in persistence storage (Like HANA Cloud). 

Can you provide a guide or help on how I can achieve it? I have done it through the REST Proxy method but it is failing to get a large set of data and getting timeout.

DB Schema

entity Product {
  key id                          : UUID;
      displayId                   : String;
      externalSystemReferences    : String;
      name                        : String;
      productType                 : String;
      description                 : String;
      published                   : Boolean;
      replicationType             : String;
      soldElectronically          : Boolean;
      markedForDeletion           : Boolean;
      activeMarketIds             : String;
      aspectId                    : String;
      baseUnitOfMeasure           : String;
      physicalProductCategory     : String;
      physicalProductGroup        : String;
      physicalProductItemCategory : String;
      physicalProductType         : String;
      salesAreaData               : String;
      unitOfMeasures              : String;
}

 SERVICE.JS

const { default: cds } = require("@sap/cds");

module.exports = cds.service.impl(async function () {
    const {
        Product
    } = this.entities;
    var firstRead = true;
    this.before('READ', Product, async (req) => {
        try {
            if (firstRead) {
                var recfound = 0;
                var pageNumber = 0; 
                var pageSize = req.query.SELECT.limit.rows.val;
                do {
                    const sapOmf = await cds.connect.to('sapOmfProductApi');
                    const resp = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products?pageNumber=' + pageNumber); // + "&pageSize=" + pageSize);
                    const products = resp;
                    const entries = [];
                    //products.forEach(product => {
                    for (const product of products) {
                        const extSystem = product.externalSystemReferences;
                        let extSysText = '';
                        if (extSystem) {
                            extSystem.forEach(es => {
                                extSysText += es.externalId + '-' + es.externalSystemId + ",";
                            });
                        }

                        const prodDetail = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products/' + product.id);
                        const amkid = prodDetail.activeMarketIds;
                        const salesArea = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.salesAreaData;
                        const uom = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.unitOfMeasures;
                        let mktext = '';
                        if (amkid) {
                            amkid.forEach(mk => {
                                mktext += mk + '-';
                            });
                        }
                        let satext = '';
                        if (salesArea) {
                            salesArea.forEach(area => {
                                satext += 'Active:' + area.active + '-' + 'Distribution Channel:' + area.distributionChannel + '-' +
                                    'Division:' + area.division + '-' + 'Pricing Ref Product:' + area.pricingReferenceProduct + '-' +
                                    'Product Pricing Group:' + area.productPricingGroup + '-' + 'Sales Org:' + area.salesOrganization + ',';
                            });
                        }

                        let uomtext = '';
                        if (uom) {
                            uom.forEach(um => {
                                uomtext += um.alternativeUnitOfMeasure + '-' + um.numerator + '-' + um.denominator + ',';
                            });
                        }
                        entries.push({
                            id: product.id,
                            displayId: product.displayId,
                            externalSystemReferences: extSysText,
                            name: product.name,
                            productType: product.productType,
                            description: product.description,
                            published: product.published,
                            replicationType: product.replicationType,
                            soldElectronically: product.soldElectronically,
                            markedForDeletion: product.markedForDeletion,
                            activeMarketIds: mktext,
                            salesAreaData: satext,
                            unitOfMeasures: uomtext,
                            aspectId: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.aspectId,
                            baseUnitOfMeasure: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.baseUnitOfMeasure,
                            physicalProductType: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductType,
                            physicalProductItemCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductItemCategory,
                            physicalProductCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductCategory,
                            physicalProductGroup: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductGroup
                        });
                    }
                    // delete all countries

                    await cds.tx(req).run(INSERT.into(Product).entries(entries));
                    firstRead = false;
                    pageNumber++;
                    recfound = entries.length;

                } while (recfound > 0);
                return req;
            }
        } catch (err) {
            req.error(500, err.message);
        }
    });
});

This is using a schema and trying to insert data in that DB table every time. I am sure this not the best method and for large set of data it is not working. Please let me know the best way and how I can fetch data in bunch like 30 records at a time.

entry.title: CAP (Node.js) OData V2 Batch Request using SAP Cloud SDK ‚Äì How to capture all errors in a changeset?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working on a use case where I need to send a batch of update/create/delete requests from a SAP CAP (Node.js) backend to an SAP S/4HANA system. I'm using the SAP Cloud SDK and the Business Accelerator Hub to build and send the OData V2 (using odata-v2-adapter) batch requests.

Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve achieved so far:

  • I‚Äôm able to send multiple requests (update/create/delete) within a single batch.
  • To ensure transactional behavior, I wrap all these requests into one changeset.
  • This works well from a transactional standpoint: if any request fails, nothing is committed in S/4.

However, here‚Äôs the problem, when one request inside the changeset fails, only a single error is returned, and the rest of the requests are not processed. This behavior is expected according to OData V2 specs and SAP Cloud SDK documentation:

  • ‚ÄúThe body of a ChangeSet response is either a response for all the successfully processed change request within the ChangeSet [...] or a single response indicating a failure of the entire ChangeSet.‚Äù (OData V2)
  • ‚ÄúIf the execution of any request within a changeset fails, the whole changeset will be reflected as an error in the response.‚Äù (SAP Cloud SDK)

What I tried:

  • Splitting requests into multiple changesets (one per request) within the same batch allows me to retrieve individual errors, but I lose transactional integrity, some changes are committed while others fail.
  • I also explored the continueOnError option from the odata-v2-adapter, but it only applies between multiple changesets, not within a single changeset. So, again, it doesn‚Äôt help with my use case. (SAP Community Q&A)

What I‚Äôm looking for:

  • Is there any way (official or workaround) to get detailed errors for all requests without sacrificing atomicity?
  • Alternatively, is there a way to simulate or validate a batch in a ‚Äúcheck‚Äù or ‚Äútest‚Äù mode, without actually executing it in the S/4HANA backend, just to detect all potential errors?
  • Or is the recommended approach, as suggested by CAP documentation, to implement strong input validation before triggering the batch, to ensure that it will succeed?

Any insights, ideas, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP S/4 Hana : Multiple API Call In One Transaction
entry.content:
Hi,

I‚Äôm developing a CAP application using Node.js. I‚Äôm consuming remote APIs from SAP S/4HANA Cloud (public edition)‚Äîfor example, reading Business Partners and creating Sales Orders. At one point, I need to call multiple APIs to perform updates and deletions in sequence. What happens if one of these calls fails midway? How can I roll back everything I‚Äôve done? Is there a good way to handle this?

Thanks.

entry.title: OAuth2.0 Authentication for S4HC APIs
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
We are trying to set up non-user interactive OAuth2.0 Authentication for S4HC APIs, to access the APIs from third party applications
Can this be achieved without BTP?
Also are the Standard APIs restricted to use only OAuth2.0 Access code flow? or can other grant types be used?


Cause when I try to set up inbound OAuth2.0 Clients in my customizing tenant, the grant type is disabled and only shows Authorization code + PKCE


And if i were to add my OAuth2.0 Provider, the autogenerated inbound Oauth2.0 clients have the grant type SAML2 Bearer Assertion. Are these the only two grant types that can be configured in the Tenant?
If BTP is my only option, could you please direct me to blogs with steps to set up Oauth2.0 client credentials in cockpit (Cloud foundry) and s4hana cloud instance and finally test from postman?
@Andre_Fischer @Sandra_Rossi @Amin_Omidy @quovadis

entry.title: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable in Product API error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and trying to perform a POST operation using the Product (API_PRODUCT_2) API.
However, I‚Äôm receiving the following error response:

{
  "error": {
    "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
    "message": "Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable",
    "target": "_ProductPurchaseOrderText(Product='102010000009',TextObjectType='BEST',Language='EN')",
    "details": [
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductProcurement"
      },
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductPlant(Product='102010000009',Plant='CN7A')/_ProductPlantProcurement"
      }
    ],
    "innererror": {
      "ErrorDetails": {
        "@SAP__common.Application": {
          "ComponentId": "LO-MD-MM",
          "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",
          "ServiceId": "API_PRODUCT_2",
          "ServiceVersion": "0001"
        },
        "@SAP__common.TransactionId": "86545C3DDA130010E0068E7D20C1703B",
        "@SAP__common.Timestamp": "20251009154237.258522",
        "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution": {
          "Analysis": "Use ADT feed reader 'SAP Gateway Error Log' or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
          "Note": "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

My Question:

  • Why are these entities (PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT, PRODUCTPROCUREMENT, PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT) not maintainable through the post API?

  • Are there any restrictions in the Public Cloud Edition for maintaining these sub-entities via API?

  • Is there an alternative API or approach to update these product procurement or purchase order text details?

 

I‚Äôve already checked the payload structure and API reference documentation, and the JSON is valid. The base product entity is being read successfully ‚Äî the error occurs only during the POST operation.

Any insights or SAP Notes related to this behavior would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Janarthanan R.

entry.title: SAP BUILD Issue with Budget Approval Template ‚Äì Missing Field in POST api API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôre currently working with the Budget Approval Template:
Workflow Budget Approval

At the end of the process, it performs a POST to the API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV service:
API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV

Initially, we faced an error related to the company field, which we resolved by following this note:
üîó SAP Note 3550655 - Company field issue

Now, we‚Äôre encountering a Budget error. After following this note and testing directly in Postman, the POST works correctly:
üîó SAP Note 3564398 - Budget error resolution

However, the issue is that the field PlanDataRplcScopeFieldsString is not available in the Build Action because it‚Äôs missing in the POST schema.
This means SAP Build currently doesn‚Äôt allow us to send this field, even though it‚Äôs required ‚Äî so it seems the POST definition and the template need to be updated by SAP.

At this point, it looks like my only workaround is to create a new custom action in Build Process Automation and manually include this field in the POST body.

Has anyone found another solution or workaround for this issue?

PS: The Build Automation template also has a mapping error when approval is not needed ‚Äî the POST mapping is incorrect in that case as well.

Thanks in advance for any insights!

Is there any way to create planned Handling Units for a given Product through an API? If yes, could someone please share an examples payload?

I‚Äôd really appreciate any tips or suggestions. Thanks a lot!
Bart

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: Link and correlation between BOI's and API's, differences in functionality and testing tools
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are developing in a S/4 Public Cloud environment (using embedded steampunk or ABAP cloud).

As part of the developments ahead, we need to "rebuild" classic developments, which use commonly known BAPIs such as BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE, which are not allowed in Public cloud, based on clean core principles.

As we move forward in research of the new ways, we found out (based on the Material Document example):

- There's a Material Document Business Object: Material Document

- There's a Material Document Business Object Interface (BOI), which is intended to be used for LOCAL (embedded) RAP developments as the ones we need: MaterialDocument / I_MATERIALDOCUMENTTP

- There's a Material Document API, which is intended to be used for SIDE-BY-SIDE (from BTP) or consumed from OUTSIDE S/4 (not the majority of our current scenarios): API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV

We also found out, while both are present and documented on Business Accelerator Hub, the API one is far more documented and friendly for a functional analyst, including even a Try-Out section to test it with data. Which is very useful as it is needed to elaborate functional specs including test cases.

This poses a problem since what we will end up using from ABAP code (by EML) is the BOI, not the API. Some people already posted in regards to this, having problems because they are not in sync in functionality or capabilities: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/functional-differences-between-boi-s-and-api-s/qaq-p/13879790 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/how-to-call-public-cloud-sap-api-from-embedded-steampunk/qaq-p/13725569

In analogy to the classic approach, the analyst was able to test the BAPIs from SE37 with data, and even save test cases to be used by reference for the developer.

Since we have no similar tool for BOIs, how we can assure and correlate the API and the BOI? Is there a 1:1 equivalence listing? Are there any plans for a BOI testing tool similar to the one provided for APIs?

Thank you!
